712727f.title: Manhattan: 41st Street - Lexington Avenue
712727f.text:
E.41st Street, west from Lexington Avenue. In the right
foreground is the Bowery Savinas SSank Building under con
struction. The Park Avenue ramp can be seen in the back-
ground.
May Be Reproduced  March 7, 1923
Neg. ~ 22442

720973f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 41st Street (East)
720973f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, south from East 41st Street. Note
the newly erected apartment house at the S. W. corner of
10th Street.
April 13, 1924
Standard Photographic Service
Gift of Borough President of Manhattan
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

720970f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 41st Street
720970f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, south from 4lst Street, showing
mainly the easterly side of this thoroughfare. The
apartment house fn the midground is at the S. E. corner
of East 38th Street. Beyond is the spire of the P. E.
Chnrch of the Epiphany at 35th Street.
April 13, 1924
Standard Photographic Service
Gift of Borough President of Manhattan
CREDIT LINE IRPERATIUE

730399f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - Lexington Avenue - 41st Street (Northeast).]
730399f-a.text:
A general view. northeast from Lexington Ave., near 41st Street,
showing the Oueensboro Bridge, (from East 59th Street, Manhattan to
Long Island City), in the distance.
August 3O, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720976f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 41st Street
720976f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, West side, from 41st to 42nd Streets, showing
the last stages of demolition of the old Manhattan Storage
Warehouse, which has occupied this site since the early 1880's.
The Chanin Building is to be erected on the site.
August 30, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720978f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 41st Street
720978f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, from 42nd to 41st Streets, showing
the Manhattan Storage and Warehouse Company's building, which
is to be torn down in 1927 to make place for the Chanin Building.
About 1926.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720974f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 41st Street
720974f-a.text:
373-371 Lexington Avenue, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of 41st
Street. These two houses are the survivors of what once was an
entire block of brownstone-front houses.
September 9, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720971f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, at S. W. corner of 41st Street.

720972f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 41st Street
720972f-a.text:
LeAington Avenue at N.E. corner of 41st Street, showing Murray Hill
Theatre, which adjoins the N.E. corner of 41st Street. This theatre
is today the Loew's 42nd Street, and shows motion pictures.
1904.
International News Photograph.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
